intro: Verbena lantanoides, commonly known as blue verbena, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its showy, sky-blue to violet flowers that bloom in summer. The plant has slender, branching stems and narrow, gray-green leaves that are covered in fine hairs. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soil, making it a popular choice for xeriscaping. Verbena lantanoides is also valued for its ability to attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
